DataElement.preferredName: Post Surgical Procedure Cleft Lip Or Palate Patient Additional Training and Education Training and Education Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A split or indentation in something._Either of the two fleshy, full-blooded margins of the mouth. (MeSH)_Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._(PAL-et) The roof of the mouth. The front portion is bony (hard palate), and the back portion is muscular (soft palate)._A person who requires medical care._Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary)_To teach theory and hands on experience__To teach theory and hands on experience_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Post Surgical Procedure Cleft Lip Or Palate Patient
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A split or indentation in something.:Either of the two fleshy, full-blooded margins of the mouth. The front portion is bony (hard palate), and the back portion is muscular (soft palate).:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A split or indentation in something.
Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The roof of the oral cavity. It separates the oral cavity from the nasal cavity.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):To teach theory and hands on experience

ReferenceDocuments.name: Which response best represent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Which response best represents the desire you have to receive additional training for patients with the following conditions? Post-surgical repair cleft lip and palate
